topic.title: <Stack> and <StackItem>
topic.p: <Stack/> arrange all direct children <SlackItem/> compositions in a line following the same direction.
If all <SlackItem/> lines of horizontally, all of them share the same height. If all <SlackItem/> lines of vertically, all of them share the same width.

topic.title: Properties
topic.p: A few more properties are provided by <Stack/> and <StackItem/> to control the details of how to ordering <StackItem/>.
<StackItem/> is not a <Bounds/>, there is no writable Bounds and AlignmentToParent in <StackItem/>.

topic.title: <Stack>::Direction
topic.p: Horizontal, ReversedHorizontal, Vertical and ReversedVertical are all valid values for this property, deciding how <StackItem/> are line up in a <Stack/>.

topic.title: <Stack>::Padding
topic.p: This property keeps an distance between each <StackItem/>.

topic.title: <Stack>::ExtraMargin
topic.p: The default value is 0 for all its components.
This property keeps an distance between <Stack/> and <StackItem/>.

topic.title: <StackItem>::ExtraMargin
topic.p: The default value is 0 for all its components.
This property adds a border to a <StackItem/>.
IMPORTANT: ExtraMargin does not affect how other <StackItem/> is located. Instead, after the position of a <StackItem/> is decided, ExtraMargin kicks in and add a border to enlarge it.
Adding an ExtraMargin to a <StackItem/> does not increase the minimum size of its parent <Stack/>.

topic.title: <Stack>::Children()
topic.p: When a new <StackItem/> is added to <Stack/> as a child, this <StackItem/> is always appended to the end of the line, regardless of its position in <Stack>::Children.

topic.title: <Stack>::InsertStackItem(index, item)
topic.p: To control the position of a <StackItem/> in a line, call <Stack>::InsertStackItem() instead of <Stack>::Children().
This function also adds a <StackItem/> to the <Stack/>, but it allows the position of this <StackItem/> in a line to be specified, instead of adding it to the end of the line.

topic.title: <Stack>::GetStackItems()
topic.p: Call this function to get all direct children <StackItem/> in the line order.

topic.title: <Stack>::IsStackItemClipped()
topic.p: This function returns false when any part of any <StackItem/> is invisible or clipped by this <Stack/>.
